sentences.sentence: On the next day the Magician came to him, and said, “If today you do not bring me the piece of yellow gold, I will keep you as my slave( 奴隶 ), and beat you three hundred times.”
And so the Star-Child went to the forest, and all day long he searched for the piece of yellow gold, but he could not find it anywhere.
At sunset( 日落 ) he sat down and began to cry, and as he was crying the little Rabbit came to him again.
The Rabbit said to him, “Why are you crying? And what are you looking for in the forest?”
The Star-Child answered, “I am looking for a piece of yellow gold that is hidden here.
And if I do not find it my master( 主人 ) will beat me, and keep me as a slave( 奴隶 ).”
“Follow me,” said the Rabbit.
The Star-Child followed the Rabbit until they arrived at a pool of water.
And at the bottom of the pool was the piece of yellow gold.
“How can I thank you?” said the Star-Child.
“This is the second time that you have helped me.”
“No, it was you who had pity on me first,” said the Rabbit.
Then it ran away quickly.
The Star-Child took the piece of yellow gold, and put it in his pocket, and hurried to the city.
But the beggar( 乞丐 ) from the day before saw him coming, and ran to meet him.
He showed the young boy his empty bowl and cried, “Give me some money, or I will die of( 死于 ) hunger.”
The Star-Child said to him, “But I only have one piece of yellow gold in my pocket.
If I do not bring it to my master( 主人 ) he will beat me, and keep me as his slave( 奴隶 ).”
But the beggar( 乞丐 ) looked so hungry, and so tired, and so unfortunate( 不幸的 ) that the Star-Child took pity on him, and gave him the piece of yellow gold.
When the Star-Child came to the Magician’s house, the Magician opened the door, and told him to come in.
Then he said to him, “Do you have the piece of yellow gold?”
And the Star-Child said to him, “I do not have it.”
So the Magician grabbed( 抓住 ) him, and beat him, and sent him again into the prison( 牢笼 ).
On the next day the Magician came to him, and said,
“If today you bring me the piece of red gold I will set you free, but if you do not bring it I will kill you.”
And so the Star-Child went to the forest, and all day long he searched for the piece of red gold, but he could not find it anywhere.
In the evening he sat down and cried, and as he was crying the little Rabbit came to him again.
The Rabbit said to him, “The piece of red gold that you are looking for is in the cave( 洞穴 ) that is behind you, so do not cry any more, but be glad.”
“How can I reward( 回报 ) you?” cried the Star-Child.
“This is the third time you have helped me.”
“No, it was you who had pity on me first,” said the Rabbit.
Then it ran away quickly.
The Star-Child entered the cave( 洞穴 ), and in its farthest corner he found the piece of gold.
He put it in his pocket, and hurried back to the city.
The beggar( 乞丐 ) saw him coming, and stood in the middle of the road, showing the young boy his empty bowl.
Then the beggar( 乞丐 ) said, “Give me the piece of money, or I will die.”
The Star-Child took pity on him once again, and gave him the piece of red gold, saying, “Your need is greater than mine.”
Yet he felt sad, because he knew what would happen to him when he went back to the Magician without the gold.

article_info.previous: 魔术师要求星孩在天黑之前在森林里找到一块白金，并带回家给他。星孩四处搜寻无果，急的哭起来，正在这时，他看到一只落入陷阱的兔子，并解救了它。为报答救命之恩，兔子帮星孩找到了白金。然而，星孩赶回去交差时，在城门口看到一个乞丐，在乞丐的哀求下，星孩把白金给了乞丐。星孩回去后，魔术师惩罚了他。
article_info.share_words: “How can I thank you?” said the Star-Child. “This is the second time that you have helped me.”“No, it was you who had pity on me first,” said the Rabbit. Then it ran away quickly.

question.cn: 当星孩找不到黄金的时候发生了什么？
question.en: What happened when the Star-Child couldn't find the yellow gold?

options.cn: 他径直去找兔子寻求帮助。
options.en: He went straight to the Rabbit and asked it for help.

options.cn: 他去了找到白金的地方。
options.en: He went to the same place where he found the white gold.
The Rabbit came to help him again.

analysis: 文中提到“. . . as he was crying the little Rabbit came to him again. . . The Star-Child followed the rabbit until they arrived at a pool of water. And at the bottom of the pool was the piece of yellow gold.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 星孩把黄金给乞丐了吗？
question.en: Did the Star-Child give the piece of yellow gold to the beggar?

analysis: 文中提到“But the beggar looked so hungry, and so tired, and so unfortunate that the Star-Child took pity on him, and gave him the piece of yellow gold.”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 为什么星孩把红金给乞丐后觉得难过？
question.en: Why did the Star-Child feel sad when he gave the red gold to the beggar?

options.cn: 因为他知道自己将受到惩罚。
options.en: Because he knew he would be punished.

options.cn: 因为他知道自己永远也找不到母亲了。
options.en: Because he knew he would never find his mother.

options.cn: 因为他后悔把金子给乞丐了。
options.en: Because he regretted giving the gold to the beggar.

analysis: 文中提到“Yet he felt sad, because he knew what would happen to him when he went back to the Magician without the gold.”可知，他是会被魔术师惩罚，因此本题选A。
